column1: Bacterial vaginosis (BV) is a type of vaginal infection.
BV is a common problem that can affect women and girls of all ages.
Symptoms of BV include: - White or gray vaginal discharge that smells fishy or unpleasant - Burning when you urinate - Itching inside and outside the vagina You also may not have any symptoms.
The speculum is opened slightly to hold the vagina open while your doctor examines the inside of your vagina and takes a sample of discharge with a sterile cotton swab.
- Wash your vagina and anus with a gentle, non-deodorant soap.
Douching removes the healthy bacteria in your vagina that protect against infection.
